attributes.action: Landlords should make a compulsory fee of £10 from rents to support homelessness
attributes.background: After seeing the incredible amount of homelessness within London and the obscene rental prices of houses, I want to see it become compulsory for landlords to give £10 out of London and £20 inner London per house to homelessness to fund better shelters / housing / general accomadation !
attributes.additional_details:
With London’s population of 8.6 million, 50% of these are in rental properties. The average house price being £743,000 it is no wonder landlords are cashing in on the ever growing need to rent. 
I truly believe that a small percentage of these rental fees would not be missed and would assist homelessness and make a considerable difference ! 
Please sign this petition to support this cause, Our children’s generation need this massive problem rectifying before it’s too late !!!

attributes.action: Pay our community care workers per shift and not per client.
attributes.background: I've worked in the care industry for around 13 years now, 4 of which have being in community care. Care agencies have a quick turn over of staff this is mainly down to being under paid which in turn effects the quality of care provided to the vulnerable and a lack of continuity.
attributes.additional_details:
The care staff that take care of others loved ones the in the community are underpaid. Most care workers will cover a 15 hour day. They will be on the road back to back with calls and sometimes only get a short break yet will be working from 7:00 - 22:00 we are only paid client time this could be only 5 hours out off the whole 15hours worked 
Mileage is paid at 25p per mile yet travel time is not paid or paid if the adverage drops below the  NMW or paid a minimum of so many minutes.

attributes.action: Put a Childcare Levy in place to help working families with childcare costs.
attributes.background: The majority of the existing childcare support options are income based and do not incentivise women to go back to work.  To claim and access childcare support is difficult. Even though the government spends £7.5n in childcare support per year, it only covers a fraction of families’ childcare costs.
attributes.additional_details: We need a well-rounded childcare infrastructure that helps working families with childcare costs and incentive women to go back to work. We need the government to incentivise companies to offer childcare arrangements as part of their benefits umbrella. We need a Childcare Levy to cover childcare costs of working parents for children up to the age of 5. We need a register of childcarers so that parents can leave their children in safe hands. www.childcarelevy.co.uk

attributes.action: Make abusers pay financial costs for forced marriage and honour abuse victims
attributes.background: When victims are abroad unfortunately to be rescued those victims over the age of 18 end up in thousands of debt to the Home Office before they start their new life! Home office help the victims but unfortunately victims have to repay their travel costs etc. Abusers should be billed not victims.
attributes.additional_details: As a victim of honour abuse and walking away at the age of 30 it came with a huge financial burden that was hard to cope with! Victims deal with more than enough like social isolation, mental health, live in hiding due to their safety etc.

attributes.action: Make statutory adoption leave and pay available for the self employed
attributes.background: Statutory adoption pay and leave is not available to those who are self employed however statutory maternity leave and pay is.  This is discriminatory against those willing and wanting to give the best start to an adopted child by being at home to nurture, care and develop a bond with their child.
attributes.additional_details:
A self employed parent who can biologically have a child can receive statutory maternity leave and pay.  If for whatever reason they have chosen to adopt a child this self employed parent has no rights to adoption pay and leave.  

By leaving self employed adoptive parents to self fund and not work over this leave, it places another barrier to the adoption process.

A prospective adopter will have a strengthened application if they can show how one parent can commit to adoption leave.

attributes.action: Make pas43 a minimum legal requirement for all breakdown and recovery personnel
attributes.background: After working with various company’s doing roadside breakdowns and recovery, some of which apply pas43. The dangers of this are horrifying. I think it’s about time these guidelines were made legal as a minimum requirement to get rid of the cowboys and to reduce further risk to everyone
attributes.additional_details:
Where some company’s will use pas43 and stick to the guidelines, give staff the required training. There are still company’s out there that will send untrained staff in any vehicle to broken down vehicles which are ill equipped and have no extra reflectors or beacon. 
I have also have an email from a parliament case worker stating pas43 is not a legal requirement and is down to the company health and safety to make sure that staff know what they are doing at the roadside. This needs to change!

attributes.action: Make cyber bullying a criminal offence
attributes.background: Ensure cyber bullying attacks both real person and fake accounts are investigated by the police and persons dealt with accordingly. Cyber bullying makes our young people and adults twice as likely to self harm. We are seeing people taking their own life because of this. Police are not preventing.

attributes.action: Change the threshold for higher rate tax to at least £60,000.
attributes.background: A person earning up to £46,350 pays basic rate tax (20%). After that the tax increases to 40% for anyone earning between £46,351 and £150,000. I feel it is unfair that a person earning £43,351 per annum should be on the same rate of tax as someone earning more than three times the salary.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.gov.uk/income-tax-rates

attributes.action: Make EV charging as easy as filling up with petrol/diesel fuel.
attributes.background: Make all charging stations accept credit or debit cards or maybe cash with no prior membership. The cost per kWh should also be displayed in the same way as fuel prices are displayed on forecourts. EV uptake will be significantly improved if owners know they can easily charge anywhere.
attributes.additional_details: To charge an EV currently requires one to be a member of a variety of different clubs with different schemes and maybe club cards in order to access charging power points. I usually charge at home but recently tried charging at a charging point but failed. I had installed Polar instants on my phone with credit but either I didn't have mobile data access or the polar servers weren't working but I was unsuccessful. Fortunately I just had enough charge to limp home.

attributes.action:
CELEBRATE BREXIT! 

Make March 29 an annual Bank Holiday
attributes.background:
On March 29 2019, we will be leaving the EU. 
We call upon the Government to mark this historic occasion by making March 29 an annual Bank Holiday. 
Where March 29 falls on a weekend, the Bank Holiday should be held on the nearest Monday. 
.
attributes.additional_details: We believe this is the best way to celebrate the result of the biggest democratic vote in our history

attributes.action: Make parking over, outside, or in anyway blocking a drive illegal.
attributes.background: I’ve gone to the expense of paying for a drive only to keep having people park over it or partially block it. The law gives them permission to do this if your car isn’t in the drive. Your drive is your drive and no one should be able to block it. Countless arguments occur daily over this issue.

attributes.action: Urge Japan to criminalise hunting, slaughter & sale of dolphins into captivity
attributes.background: In Taiji hunters drive pods of dolphins with banger/speed boats & nets into the cove for sale into captivity, slaughter or release. The drive is brutal, captivity of wild dolphins is cruel, slaughter in front of their family is devastating & release is heartbreaking for young who lost family members
attributes.additional_details: http://www.wowvstaiji.com/

attributes.action: Fund more services to Walsall by looking at reopening old lines and stations.
attributes.background: I am writing to please ask the government to look into reopening the old lines around Walsall like the Sutton Park Line, South Staffordshire Line, Walsall-Wolverhampton Line and to please add services to Wellington, Stafford, Shropshire, Wolverhampton (Direct) and to other places in England.

attributes.action: Increase the sentence time for those caught endangering aircraft with drones
attributes.background: A maximum sentence of 5 years for endangering aircraft, those on board, people on the ground as well as the untold catastrophic disruption is too short. I feel that this maximum sentence should be increased to reflect the criminally reckless and dangerous behaviour
attributes.additional_details:
It only took two drones to cause widespread mayhem at Gatwick airport on the 19th and 20th of December requiring the armed forces to be deployed.

Given the widespread and increasing availability of drone technology a stronger sentence is the best deterrent to stop further breaches of aircraft safety through drone technology.

A stronger sentence will prevent even the accidental breach of security as operators will be greatly aware of the consequences of flying a drone in restricted airspace.

attributes.action: Stop taxing the state pension, the elderly already paid their tax while working
attributes.background: It is wrong for our elderly to be further taxed on their pensions when they have already paid enough tax throughout their working lives.
attributes.additional_details: The old age pension should not be taxed you taxed us already.

attributes.action: Support unmarried couples when a partner/civil partner dies in the relationship
attributes.background: The law should reflect on the deceased’s ‘living’ circumstances and life choices in who should be supported financially especially when a WILL is not in place against that the law protects and supports only them of a married status.
attributes.additional_details: I lost my partner who I was with for 2 and a half years and we have a son who was aged 1 at the time of my partners passing. He had started divorce proceedings with his previous partner but yet these where not finalised at his time of death due to amendments needed to the paperwork. I received no financial support from government bereavement support and myself and my son received no financial support from his estate. He did not have a will and government and estate finances were all awarded to his previous partner

attributes.action: Stop the manufacture and importation of non biodegradable plastics
attributes.background: Our planet is choking on non bio degradable plastics. We need to act NOW and immediately stop the manufacture and importation of these life threatening products.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for there to be CCTV in special and PRU schools
attributes.background: Special needs schools and PRU settings often need to use restraint procedures on children to ensure the safety of children and staff. During a restraint, my son has sustained 16 injuries on his face, neck, arms, legs, chest, abdomen and back. CCTV would ensure that incidents can be investigated.
attributes.additional_details: If schools had CCTV there would be no question about these events. Staff and parents could watch the events unfold and staff can be held to account if needed, or shown to be using resonable force if they were. It is important that there is an unbiased view of the events as when a child needs restraining, emotions run high, as often staff can get hurt. CCTV would show what happened and why and mean that it is easy and transparent to investigate.

attributes.action: Ensure costs for restoring order at HMP Birmingham are met by G4S not taxpayers
attributes.background: In 2011, the running of HM Prison Birmingham was entrusted to outsourcing company G4S. As G4S has failed in its responsibilities, the government should ensure that any costs associated with restoring appropriate conditions at the prison are met by the company and not by the taxpayer.
attributes.additional_details:
The company’s failure to maintain order and provide a safe, habitable environment that will ensure the rehabilitation of inmates, and their return to society has been reported by HM Inspectorate of Prisons www.justiceinspectorates.gov.uk and the prison has now been placed under the control of the Ministry of Justice. 
 
As G4S has been found to have failed in its duty of care to the inmates and staff alike, the Government should take all possible steps to ensure the taxpayer is not penalised for the company’s failure to meet its contractual obligations.

attributes.action: If a parent refuses child visitation then maintenance should be non-payable
attributes.background: When a couple separate and the resident-parent still with the children refuses any visitation, then the other non-resident parent should not be held accountable for high child maintenance payments when they want to see the children.
attributes.additional_details: Even if they haven’t got any money, the non-resident parent is still hounded to pay without any visitation rights. The stress caused by these situations is at times unbearable yet any non-paying parent is often seen as a bad parent when that’s not the actual case.

attributes.action: People  who take  in animals  by law should  check  for a microchip.
attributes.background: All animals  picked up should be taken  by  law to get checked  for  a microchip.
attributes.additional_details: I live in the w14 area  and in the last 6 weeks I have discovered  that  12 cats have  gone  missing  in 6 week's all from good  homes all  sprayed mirichipped  adult cats.

attributes.action: Make self defence part of the physical education curriculum
attributes.background: With more and more assaults and the increase of knife crime, I think it should be mandatory that schools teach their students self defence.
attributes.additional_details: In 2017, there were just under 39,600 recorded offences involving the use of a knife or sharp instrument in England and Wales. That’s the highest level recorded over a year since comparable figures began in 2011.

attributes.action: Require a child train fare to be ages 5-16 whilst in full time education
attributes.background: Rail companies define child fares as from age 5-15. But a 16 year old can still be at school (Year 11) and has to pay an adult fare.
attributes.additional_details: Companies cite the young person railcard however this cannot be used for morning fares, season tickets or fares under a certain cost. Student discounts aren't available until Year 12. This means that in their most important year 16 year old children and their family are facing the stress of paying double the amount. http://www.nationalrail.co.uk/times_fares/46494.aspx

attributes.action: Introduce heavy taxation on palm oil so businesses remove it from their products
attributes.background: We lose 25 orangutans per day, largely due to the palm oil industry which requires the burning of trees such as the oil palm, which is their natural habitat. The government should heavily tax palm oil so businesses are discouraged from using it in their products and find other, better alternatives.
attributes.additional_details: Iceland state that they're removing palm oil from all of their own label products which shows that it is more than possible for businesses to do and to follow suit. Therefore, I am calling for heavy taxation on palm oil so it is not financially viable for businesses to use it, and therefore they find a less damaging and more ethical alternative.

attributes.action:
Refuse to uphold the NI (Executive Formation and
Exercise of Functions) Bill.
attributes.background: This Bill will compromise democracy in NI, placing decision-making in the hands of unelected civil servants and retrospectively blocking challenges to the Secretary of State's requirement to call an election within a reasonable period of time, an important safeguard to our democratic institutions.
attributes.additional_details: Our government may be currently at a stalemate, but Parliament has no mandate from the people of Northern Ireland to revoke our democratic rights and their safeguards.

attributes.action: Change the Family Law to protect non-resident parents and make contact easy.
attributes.background:
There are parents who have their kids full time, that use the kids as weapons against their ex partners, refusing contact or extra contact to the children, if certain demands are not adhered to. 
This in turn is causing suicide, mental illness, physical illness, and financial hardship.
attributes.additional_details:
There needs to be a signed agreement when parents split detailing the days that the non-resident parent can see the kids. This should be done at the local council and be a document that is recognised by the court of law as a binding contract. In addition: 
• CSA should be overhauled to take into account not just the non-resident’s income, but their cost of living. 
• The 48 hour fortnight law should be changed to 53 hours, giving the leaving parent a chance to see their kids after school. An extra one day in a week during school half term should also be introduced.

attributes.action: Debate the government's adoption of the IHRA definition in its entirety.
attributes.background: The UK government to debate their decision to accept the IHRA definition of antisemitism in its entirety based on the observations of learned counsel & others that it is flawed.
attributes.additional_details: Some people consider that the IHRA definition and the examples are poorly drafted, misleading, and could lead to the suppression of legitimate debate and freedom of expression.

attributes.action: Make it a legal obligation for businesses to turn all lights off after close.
attributes.background: The large majority of business's in the UK will keep lights running throughout the night in order to advertise their company. On a large scale this is a huge waste of our resources and banning this act could be a simple step to significantly reduce our countries impact on the environment.

attributes.action: Demand a public inquiry into the serious failings of South Western Railway.
attributes.background:
In March 2017, the DfT awarded the south west railway franchise to First/MTR - South Western Railway, for a minimum term of 7 years.

To date the franchise has delivered:

Relentless delays & cancellations 
Incorrect or no travel info 
Aggressive revenue enforcement 
Onerous claims process
attributes.additional_details:
More details
https://www.standard.co.uk/news/transport/one-in-four-trains-late-each-day-on-troubled-south-western-railway-a3994856.html 
https://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-6482487/Commuters-hit-delays-cancellations-South-Western-Railway.html 
https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2018/12/09/christmas-rail-passengers-facing-perfect-storm-delays-disruption/ 
https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-46258720 
https://www.bournemouthecho.co.uk/news/17255492.letter-to-the-editor/

attributes.action: Solar households should not be made to give away excess power to energy firms
attributes.background: "The government has said households that install solar panels in the future (April 2019) will be expected to give away unused clean power for free to energy firms earning multimillion-pound profits". This is deeply unfair and gives no incentive to make green changes.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.theguardian.com/business/2018/dec/18/solar-power-energy-firms-government?CMP=fb_gu&fbclid=IwAR2c0V8vm3sMUlCfdKCQHg0KWz728VzpYZ69gGbNho-3I6cj1d4L0pjgSyM

attributes.action: Brexit must mean leaving the Defence Union
attributes.background: The Chequers plan keeps the UK signed up to EU defence and weapons development budgets. Veterans for Britain’s briefing paper reveals how the UK has reached such a perilous position, where we are close to giving away political control over large parts of defence decision-making to new EU structures
attributes.additional_details:
A crucial intervention in The Times by ex-MI6 chief Sir Richard Dearlove plus military and academic figures, pointed out how the Cabinet Office Europe Unit, headed by Oliver Robbins, had shared information about the defence negotiating position with EU diplomats before these details and their consequences had been explained to MPs.

The EU has no business being in defence or security at all. These should be either NATO or nation-to-nation matters.

attributes.action: Make it an offence to own a cat over the age of 6 months that isn't microchipped
attributes.background: To see a dog roaming on its own causes concern, yet a cat on the streets doesn't? Cats are provided freedom by their owners but can, like anyone get lost, so surely we should have greater protection over them as it became a requirement in 2016 for dogs to be chipped. They're family too and loved.
attributes.additional_details: I helped my neighhour rehome his cats due to illness and provided the family who took them with paperwork, advice and medication (regular flea and worming treatment). Only to find out months later they were found under a shed, near starved and miles away from our home. Many facebook posts of injured or dead cats receive less shares than those of dogs. Owners of cats love their pets equally and it's about time that society recognises this despite their preferences of a pet and family member.

attributes.action: Prevent persons on the sex offenders register from running a licensed premises
attributes.background:
There are numerous licences premises being run leased and occupied by convicted sex offenders in this country. 
I have been told that this is within the law. 
In my opinion and many others this should not be allowed.

attributes.action: To Make it Mandatory for cinemas to show at least 4 films a week subtitled.
attributes.background: I am a 13 year old boy who is hearing impaired, and fed up with not being able to watch movies like my friends can. I miss out on so many movies. The cinemas only show at best one a week and they are usually at very inconvenient times. Why can’t there be 4 subtitled showings of every movie a week?
attributes.additional_details: I have checked at multiple cinemas, and they have said that you can request for a film to be shown subtitled, however there are no guarantees they will and also they require several weeks notice with no flexibility on times or days, which means I am usually left with their day and time schedule or nothing, which is more often the case. I feel very strongly that this is unfairly discriminating people with a hearing impairment. Given that, most movies are shown around 5 to 10 times a day for 2 or 3 weeks, resulting in at least 105 showings of each film. I don’t feel that it’s too much too ask to have 4 subtitled showings a week.

attributes.action: Move responsibility for the laws on equal marriage from NI back to UK Parliament
attributes.background: The responsibility for the law on equal marriage in NI is devolved to the Northern Ireland Assembly which is currently not sitting. This petition is to move that responsibility back to the UK Parliament, after which a petition to change the law to align with the rest of the UK can be made
attributes.additional_details: As NI is part of the UK, it should have the same laws on issues such as equal marriage when the rest of the UK does. See Marriage (Same Sex Couples) Act 2013

attributes.action: The British people should have a referendum on abolishing the Monarchy.
attributes.background: The British people should be given a referendum to decide whether to keep the Monarchy or become a republic.
attributes.additional_details: The British public should be given a vote to decide whether to keep the Monarchy or not.

attributes.action: Regulate the transfer of terminally people ill from home to palliative care.
attributes.background: Transfers from home to palliative care usually involve a number of public and commercial services, each following their own safeguarding procedures. However, if serious omissions are to be avoided there is a pressing need for a mechanism which locks these different safeguarding procedures together.
attributes.additional_details:
A central Government initiative, in the form of national protocol or code of practice, would help to ensure that certain standards are achieved by all those involved in transferring the terminally ill from home to palliative care.

Any central Government protocol or code of practice would need to be embedded in the various safeguarding procedures and this should lead to improved collaboration, better communication and a more collaborative way of working for all those involved.

attributes.action: Allow the public to decide by referendum on any Brexit 'no deal' not Parliament
attributes.background:
The public voted to leave the EU to be better off.
A 'no deal' Brexit will result in the UK being substantially worse off.
The final decision to accept a no deal Brexit  it is so fundamental to the future of the UK that it should be made or rejected by the British people.
attributes.additional_details:
The referendum will allow the public the opportunity to take the decision for the UK based the facts of a no deal.
A no deal Brexit has profound implications for the future way of life for the people of the United Kingdom.
The confidence held by the UK in its members of Parliament will be enhanced by being allowed to take this final decision by referendum. Equally, should Parliament take the decision the potential public anger at being worse off could cause public unrest and further division.

attributes.action: Make hate speech against disabled people a criminal offence.
attributes.background: "Disableism" and discrimination based on your physical or cognitive ability has long been both unacceptable socially and legislatively. However, verbal abuse is often the start of such discrimination and has for too long been left as "colloquial" or dismissed as "slang" . It is time for this to end
attributes.additional_details: Children and young people who have additional needs are more likely to end up in a youth offending programme, less likely to have their mental health needs taken seriously and more likely to be lower earners. Our society disadvantages those with any form of disability in subtle ways. Verbal abuse, the use of words that are as insulting to disabled people as the worst racist abuse, are demonstrative of underlying social acceptance of this discrimination. We need to take a stand, make this not just socially unacceptable but criminal.

attributes.action: Make any form of bullying a punishable criminal offence
attributes.background:
As my son is suffering continued bullying and nothing being done . 
And to stop other children being bullied.

attributes.action: Make the date of leaving the eu our uk independance day
attributes.background: When we leave the eu it will be a great part of our uk history. So calling it our independance day could be celibrated by future generations.

attributes.action: Sanction Jair Bolsonsaro’s Brazil if they reverse laws protecting the Amazon.
attributes.background: Jair Bolsonsaro government threatens to destroy the Amazon rainforest. It is the responsibility of the world’s other nations to intervene. The destruction of the world’s most valuable ecological resource will have knock on environmental effects that threaten the whole planet and not just Brazil.

attributes.action: Independent review of unfair fines on drivers by local councils.
attributes.background: In recent years councils (despite it being illegal to use cameras as a revenue stream), have used cameras to catch motorists committing minor misdemeanours, raking in millions of pounds each year.
attributes.additional_details:
I believe motorists are now being seen as easy pickings and are used as "Cash Cows". In many cases it appears councils are turning a blind eye to Bad Signage over and above the safety of the general public. 
The internet, national and local press are littered with examples but in only very few cases have councils been held to task and refunded fines. There should be an independent review of the law.
Almost every motoring organisation has at some time highlighted the problem but still seem powerless to put a stop to this highway robbery. 
With your support we can force a debate in parliament.

attributes.action: Raise awareness about a newly found Genetic Condition EBF3-HADDS
attributes.background:
I am starting this online petition for the UK government to Raise more awareness about this newly found Genetic Condition syndrome called EBF3-HADDS.
This rare mutations in the gene has just recently been found so very little is know. About it. Help us raise more awareness about it please.
attributes.additional_details: https://ebf3blog.wordpress.com

attributes.action: License Push Bikes
attributes.background:
Who has had enough of being left with the repair costs, when involved in an accident with a push bike? 
Personally I am sick of being left at the roadside after a bike has hit my vehicle and then fled the scene.
attributes.additional_details:
The Motor Car Act 1903, required all motor vehicles to be entered on an official vehicle register, and to carry alphanumeric plates. The Act was passed in order that vehicles could be easily traced in the event of an accident or contravention of the law. 
It’s seem evidently obvious that this should apply to push bike, so they can be held accountable for their actions.
Let all get together and make a difference, sign this petition and let’s get our voice heard.

attributes.action: To ask the UK government to investigate the contract given to Seaborne freight.
attributes.background: Seaborne Freight was awarded a contract of £13.8 million to operate a Ro Ro ferry service between Ostend and Ramsgate. Seaborne Freight currently do not own or operate any vessel required to carry out such an operation they also have no trading background or licenses pertaining to such a service.
attributes.additional_details: We believe the government has not shown any "due diligence" or has followed any tender regulations in awarding this contract to Seaborne Freight, therefore we call on the government to suspend this contract as it seems to be illegal and underhand pending a full investigation into why it was awarded and other legitimate companies were not asked to tender. Thank you

attributes.action: Change animal abuse law: make a UK register for people who abuse animals.
attributes.background: The law against animal abuse needs changing. We need a animal abuse register to stop people from owning pets when they have previously abused one. It should state who they are and what they did.

attributes.action: Allow cannabis oil to be prescribed for terminally ill cancer patients
attributes.background: The UK has recently approved medical cannabis oil on the NHS but not for terminal cancer patients. All terminal cancer suffers should be able to receive cannabis oil. Please sign this petition and let's give these suffers hope of a more fulfilled life.

attributes.action: Abolish the Electoral Commission!
attributes.background: The Electoral Commission is meant to be independent. However we believe it has been partisan in its decision making and they treat some individuals differently to others, particularly over the issue of Brexit.
attributes.additional_details:
The reputation of the Electoral Commission has suffered after accusations of political bias in the conduct of its investigations. We believe that it is time to create a new independent body to replace the discredited Electoral Commission. 
 
Abolish the Electoral Commission now!

attributes.action: Give equal child related financial support to all families,not just "low income"
attributes.background: "Low income"families receive an abundance of financial help when they have a child.Tax credits/Maternity grants/benefits/free nursey places etc.With such low maternity pay slashing working household income I believe that all families with young children should receive the same financial help.
attributes.additional_details:
Some of the support available for "low income" families.

Maternity grants
Child tax credits
Healthy start scheme
Housing benefit
Free nursery from a younger age than those who are not low income.
Council tax reduction
Etc etc

If you fall above the threshold and receive no help, you can end up worse off than those "low income families" and working harder for it too.

All babies/children deserve the same start/support from our government. We pay into the system, so support us when we need it.
